channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16256] Purpose of EnvironmentEdge, EnvironmentEdgeManager
item.description:
I am trying to figure out the purpose of EnvironmentEdge in the HBase code.
The java doc says it has something to do with environment, I feel it is vague. It looks like there is a bigger picture for such a design. Currently only concrete method that is available in it is currentTime().

Can anyone summarize the rationale behind having EnvironmentEdge/EnvironmentEdgeManager ?

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Using git blame on the class, it went in here Sai Teja Ranuva:

HBASE-2578 Add ability for tests to override server-side timestamp setting (currentTimeMillis)

Then take a look through the various EnvironmentEdge issues: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-16256?jql=project%20%3D%20HBASE%20AND%20text%20~%20environmentedge

In particular, look at HBASE-6476 It is attempt to put EE everywhere but then good discussion on why it won't work just doing it everywhere (see comments by Nicolas Liochon. Our Matteo Bertozzi is good on this too, on why it won't work having it everywhere (much of our system depends on time elapsing...)

Hope this helps some.
Is this a request for better (java)docs or just a one-off explanation?

I was going through the code, found it surprising that it just has CurrentTimeInMillis,
so I raised this JIRA to get better clarity of the purpose EnvironmentEdge.
Docs had little information. It might be better to write the rationale behind it in the Class Doc.
Yes, it helped. Thank you stack.

Added the purpose of the Environment Edge Manager
to the class doc. The reasons why it is not being used
for the purpose it was designed for currently.
